title: Build Adaptive Settings Page
description: Create a settings page that uses platform-appropriate widgets for all controls.
instructions: Build an AdaptiveSettingsPage that displays: (1) A platform-appropriate app bar with title 'Settings', (2) A switch for 'Dark Mode' using CupertinoSwitch on iOS and Switch on Android, (3) A switch for 'Notifications', (4) A 'Log Out' button that shows a platform-appropriate confirmation dialog. Use CupertinoPageScaffold and CupertinoNavigationBar on iOS, Scaffold and AppBar on Android.

hints.text: Create a getter like 'bool get _isIOS => Theme.of(context).platform == TargetPlatform.iOS' for easy platform checking
Use CupertinoPageScaffold with CupertinoNavigationBar for iOS, Scaffold with AppBar for Android
Don't forget SafeArea inside CupertinoPageScaffold to handle the notch

commonMistakes.consequence: Content appears under the notch or status bar on iOS
commonMistakes.correction: Wrap content in SafeArea when using CupertinoPageScaffold

commonMistakes.consequence: Visual inconsistency and potential theming issues
commonMistakes.correction: Use Cupertino equivalents (CupertinoButton, CupertinoSwitch) when in Cupertino context
